claim: Cristiano Ronaldo leads the ranking of players taller than 180 cm when ordered by average heading accuracy.
extra_info: heights are above 180 refers to Player.height > 180; average heading accuracy = DIVIDE(SUM(heading_accuracy), COUNT(player_fifa_api_id));
reasoning: Cristiano Ronaldo (height 185.42 cm) has an average heading accuracy of ~85.52, which does not lead the ranking. Michael Ballack leads with ~91.8, followed by Fernando Llorente (~91.52) and John Terry (~91.33). Ronaldo is not at the top.

	`birthday`	TEXT,
	`height`	INTEGER,
	`weight`	INTEGER

content.text: Good, both `height` and `heading_accuracy` columns exist. Now let me query the ranking.

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "
SELECT p.player_name, 
       CAST(SUM(pa.heading_accuracy) AS REAL) / COUNT(pa.player_fifa_api_id) AS avg_heading_accuracy
FROM Player p
JOIN Player_Attributes pa ON p.player_fifa_api_id = pa.player_fifa_api_id
WHERE p.height > 180
GROUP BY p.player_fifa_api_id
ORDER BY avg_heading_accuracy DESC
LIMIT 10;
"

content.text: Let me also check where Cristiano Ronaldo appears and confirm his height:

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "
SELECT p.player_name, p.height,
       CAST(SUM(pa.heading_accuracy) AS REAL) / COUNT(pa.player_fifa_api_id) AS avg_heading_accuracy
FROM Player p
JOIN Player_Attributes pa ON p.player_fifa_api_id = pa.player_fifa_api_id
WHERE p.player_name LIKE '%Cristiano Ronaldo%'
GROUP BY p.player_fifa_api_id;
"
input.description: Check Cristiano Ronaldo's height and heading accuracy

content.text:
Cristiano Ronaldo is taller than 180 cm (185.42), but his average heading accuracy is 85.52, which is far below the top player Michael Ballack at 91.8. Cristiano Ronaldo does **not** lead this ranking.
